title.narrative: Building elements of DRF Oxfam PH

description.narrative:
Extreme weather events such as droughts, floods, tropical cyclones, and pandemics threatens lives, liveli-hoods, and the entire economies. In Asia-Pacific, 40% of the major natural disasters reported 50% loss in most country#s economy, compromising 1% oftheir annual GDP .
Disaster exacerbates poverty and affects economies as its increases in frequency and intensity. It hit hard-est poorest population by destroying lives, homes and livelihoods, especially the most vulnerable who doesn#t have social protection and access to formal financial services to help the manage financial stresses and shocks. As the population continues to grow and as damaged assets accumulates in disaster-prone areas, financial impact of disasters will continue to rise. To mitigate further disaster losses, Oxfam is inte-grating disaster risk financing in its B-Ready project to innovate how disaster financial impact can ad-dressed. Currently, the project#s theory of change would like to reduce disaster costs by:
1. Investing in disaster preparedness than relief through use of parametric forecast and digital finance technologies to save lives. It is estimated that US$1 invested in preparedness saves US$4-7 in relief and recovery costs. 2. Build-up uptake of the government andfinancial sector to managing disaster-related liabilities by de-veloping disaster risk financing policy, instruments and products. The purpose of the study is to deliver a high-quality scoping research with the financial sector (i.e. micro finance institutions / MFIs and reinsurers, product developers) to explore windows for cooperation and opportunities most especially a customized disaster risk financing product to help disaster vulnerable population be prepared in times of disaster and to increase resilience by managing financial stresses and shocks brought by poverty and/or disaster.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Great Britain#s Philippine office has been in existence since 1987. It has maintained a developmental program in the country that has gradually shifted from relief and basic services provision to a more rights-based developmental approach. Oxfam Great Britain has supported community-based coastal resources management since the early 1990s, as an approach towards an integration of coastal ecosystem rehabilitation, poverty alleviation, and political equity concerns for small-scale sectors. Oxfam inthe Philippines works towards a future where Filipinos, especially women and other vulnerable sectors, are free from the injustices of poverty. During emergencies, we respond with life-saving aid while supporting people recover their livelihoods. Everyday, we drive change by working hand-in-hand with our partners in finding practical yet innovative ways to help families lift themselves out of poverty by influencing decisions that affect them.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
